title.narrative: The Network for Religious and Traditional Peacemakers

description.narrative: Finn Church Aid (FCA) serves as the Secretariat to the Network for Religious and Traditional Peacemakers. 2014 was the first operational year of the Network and FCA was appointed as an interim secretariat of the network to carry out and coordinate its acti vities. The Secretariat of the network is based in Helsinki but the scope of the network is global. The project is effected in close cooperation with the UN the Ministry for Foreign Affairs and other partners. The Network's activities are focused on develo ping countries.The objective is to improve the effectiveness and sustainability of mediation efforts through strengthening local ownership and supporting the positive role of religious and traditional leaders in mediation. In 2015 the Network?s activities include:1. Support for local mediation activities,2. International advocacy for the inclusive engagement of religious and traditional peacemakers,3. Research and thematic development including the Network's thematic task forces,4. Networking activities and support to the Network.The Network strives to prevent conflicts and work for their resolution through peaceful means. Thus it supports the capacity building of local actors and citizens in developing countries and strengthens their role in their own devel opment. The Network includes gender equality objectives in a cross-cutting manner which is one of the main priorities for the MFA in supporting the Network.The budget for the year 2015 is 1 024 653 ? of which FCA covers 388 529 ?.
